column4: I am having a problem using ImageWriter to make a bootable USB drive with UNR if anyone thinks that they can help me with this.
DO you think that I should abandon that tutorial and try the one you linked to?
are you using ubuntu to create the usb  flash drive?
And I tried the IMageWriter software from both that tutorial page and an (apparently) upgraded version from the Package Manager
what did you say you are trying to put on the USB?
A copy of Ubuntu Netbook Remix (ubuntu-9.04-netbook-remix-i386.img)
i'm pretty sure that you can use the software I linked to.  it takes like 2 seconds with that program
OK, I'll try that, thank you.
hmm..  i used this program on a windows machine to then create the USB boot drive for the ubuntu OS.  so i'll have to look at it real quick
OK. Also, the image I have for UNR is a .img, not a .iso
have you tried the ubuntu installation tutorial?  hmm.. i just figured if you had XP running you could have it done in no time.  not sure how much time it'll take you this way
Yeah, I have the ImageWriter program, but for some reason it isn't installing on my flash drive.
i unfortunately  do not have experience with that program
OK, that's alright. Thanks for trying to help.
